articles.headline: Pounding Keys, Not Gavels, to Sell India’s Tea
articles.snippet: The cacophony of India’s public tea auctions will soon give way to the gentle tapping of keyboards as the country’s tea markets are set to go digital.
articles.abstract: The cacophony of India’s public tea auctions will soon give way to the gentle tapping of keyboards as the country’s tea markets are set to go digital.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUWAHATI, India  Traders crowd around wooden desks in a huge dusty auditorium, poring over thick catalogs describing chests of tea. A broker seated at the front of the room calls out prices in a quick, rolling cadence as the traders shout and gesture, signaling their bids.

articles.headline: Banks Hunting for More Cash
articles.snippet: The bill for the credit mess keeps rising. Bank of America raised its loss reserves, and Citigroup sought investors as banks’ credit problems dragged on.
articles.abstract: The bill for the credit mess keeps rising. Bank of America raised its loss reserves, and Citigroup sought investors as banks’ credit problems dragged on.
articles.lead_paragraph: The bill for the credit mess keeps rising.

articles.headline: A Developer, His Deals and His Ties to McCain
articles.snippet: For John McCain, who has pledged to avoid conflicts of interest in office, Donald R. Diamond can pose a test.
articles.abstract: For John McCain, who has pledged to avoid conflicts of interest in office, Donald R. Diamond can pose a test.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald R. Diamond, a wealthy Arizona real estate developer, was racing to snap up a stretch of virgin California coast freed by the closing of an Army base a decade ago when he turned to an old friend, Senator John McCain.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: In Sadr City, Basic Services Are Faltering
articles.snippet: The restoration of basic services like electricity and trash collection is lagging, jeopardizing the effort to win over wary residents of the Shiite area of Baghdad.
articles.abstract: The restoration of basic services like electricity and trash collection is lagging, jeopardizing the effort to win over wary residents of the Shiite area of Baghdad.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Even as American and Iraqi troops are fighting to establish control of the Sadr City section of this capital, the Iraqi government’s program to restore basic services like electricity, sewage and trash collection is lagging, jeopardizing the effort to win over the area’s wary residents.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Investing and Politics
articles.snippet: Many of the wealthiest hedge fund managers are lining up behind a seemingly unlikely choice in the presidential race.
articles.abstract: Many of the wealthiest hedge fund managers are lining up behind a seemingly unlikely choice in the presidential race.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you were a member of the Wall Street aristocracy, one of those hedge fund hot shots who makes half a billion dollars a year, which horse would you bet on in the race for the White House?

articles.headline: Price Volatility Adds to Worry on U.S. Farms
articles.snippet: Wild swings in crop futures are damaging mechanisms that are supposed to cushion the jolts of farming.
articles.abstract: Wild swings in crop futures are damaging mechanisms that are supposed to cushion the jolts of farming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fred Grieder has been farming for 30 years on 1,500 acres near Bloomington, in central Illinois. That has meant 30 years of long days plowing, planting, fertilizing and hoping that nothing happens to damage his crop.

articles.headline: Gas Reaches $3.50, With Little Hope for Relief
articles.snippet: Gasoline prices surpassed $3.50 a gallon nationwide for the first time and oil jumped to a record on Monday as the long rise of energy prices showed little signs of abating.
articles.abstract: Gasoline prices surpassed $3.50 a gallon nationwide for the first time and oil jumped to a record on Monday as the long rise of energy prices showed little signs of abating.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gasoline prices surpassed $3.50 a gallon nationwide for the first time and oil jumped to a record on Monday as the long rise of energy prices showed little evidence of giving way to recession fears.

articles.headline: Wall St. Journal Editor Expected to Resign
articles.snippet: Friends and colleagues differed as to whether Marcus W. Brauchli was being forced out or leaving out of frustration.
articles.abstract: Friends and colleagues differed as to whether Marcus W. Brauchli was being forced out or leaving out of frustration.
articles.lead_paragraph: Marcus W. Brauchli will step down as the top-ranking editor of The Wall Street Journal after less than a year in the job, four people briefed on the matter said on Monday, just four months after Rupert Murdoch took control of the paper.
